column1: Eilenach was the second of the seven beacon-hills of Gondor
column2: after Amon Dîn in the east
column3: and it was the highest point of the Drúadan Forest. It had a sharp summit
column4: incapable of sustaining a large fire. Its main purpose was to relay the fire of Amon Dîn to Nardol.

column1: On the night of 7 March  Gandalf and Peregrin Took
column3: saw the beacons being lit to call for aid from Rohan.

column1: On the origin of the name
column2: J.R.R. Tolkien wrote Eilenach is "probably an alien name
